title: "Self-Hypnosis Technique for Deep Sleep and Inner Power"
first_phrase: In this final section, the focus is on how to effectively enter a state of hypnosis by using sleep as a means of annihilation. The text describes specific physical and mental exercises to help facilitate this process. It also explains an alternative method for those who wish to practice during the day instead of at night. The technique involves applying pressure to the forehead while visualizing the mathematical symbol for infinity. The goal is to activate both hemispheres of the brain and access subtler dimensions of consciousness. The text refers to the importance of understanding the interdependent nature of our individual lives and how this knowledge can inform the practice of self-hypnosis. The text mentions concepts such as "contingent balance," "different entities," and "third degree." Finally, it introduces the method of applying pressure to the forehead, closing the eyes and covering the ears if one is in a situation where sleep isn't practical.
